website_summaries.verdict: This large, well-constructed steel screen comes at a surprisingly reasonable price.
pros: We love the durable steel construction with its stylish vintage iron look
Its large frame measures 52 inches long by 31 inches high
cons: Though generally well-made, the hinges could be better

customer_reviews.title: Not just for fireplaces !!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fireplace screen to use as a pet gate for my ‘escape artist kitty’ she is notorious for finding escape routes from every pet gate we have tried. The fireplace screen adds needed weight making it near impossible for her to push through or crawl under. We have installed clips on either side of the door to prevent it from falling & hurting any kitties. Since the screen is covered in mesh its the perfect cat gate! We get fresh air and don’t have to worry about ‘escape artist’ kitty sneaking out and getting run over by cars or eaten by bears.
customer_reviews.author: CaliGal66

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two-sided see-through fireplace.
customer_reviews.text: We liked the straight lines of the screens. They worked great for our two-sided see-through fireplace. (Pics from both sides included in this review.) I read reviews of rust on the screens from previous reviewers. There was rust "dust" on a few edges, but had nothing to do with the screens rusting. Had to simply wipe off the dust. Vendor should do a better job of keeping their packaging area clean. We love our screens almost as much as our National Championship LSU Tigers. Geaux Tigers!!
customer_reviews.author: George M.

customer_reviews.title: So the good is that it looks nice
customer_reviews.text: So the good is that it looks nice. the bad is that the hinges are pretty cheap and the welds are not strong. The first one I got had a broken hinge upon arrival, probably through shipping, but the second one works. I am sure that with a hard fall or two on my floor the hinge could very well break again. I would recommend but durability is definitely questionable. If you have kids or pets who might knock it over perhaps look for something else. Otherwise go ahead and get it!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great fireplace screen. We're using it at a flip house we're doing. It's an older house & the fireplace opening is taller than the 30" which much be standard since that's what most screens seem to be. This one is 31" & fit great. It is light weight but seemed to be well made. I saw several reviews that talked about shoddy workmanship, but the one I received has no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Hadsock

customer_reviews.title: It looked like a good price, but I have to replace it before the season has ended so not such a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice enough looking screen, but the hinges are badly tack welded. There are two welds for each hinge and there are 2 hinges on each side. One broke within a week of arrival. The other on the same side lasted a couple of months, but now there is nothing holding it together. At the moment, I just propped in place and am looking for a new screen.

customer_reviews.title: Nice design and finish
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and finish, but the quality is poor. The mesh is wavy and not tacked to the uprights. One tack weld was broken on the hinge (yes, the hinges are welded to the square tube with a single tack) so I had to grind it down and tack it back up. For the price, I think it's worth it if you are willing to possibly repair it on arrival. It fits the bill if you can't or won't spend $250 on a nice one.

customer_reviews.title: Nice style, but be aware of defects that can cut you!
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of this screen, and it was the perfect size for my fireplace, but be very careful when unpacking it and setting it up! Mine had a small, very sharp metal spike sticking out from one of the edges -- a flaw in the manufacturing -- and it cut my finger and drew blood. A rather painful first impression! I'm hoping to be able to file down the spike so that it doesn't cut anyone else, but it's a shame it went out the door in this condition to begin with. Hopefully this was only a problem with mine, but other buyers may want to be careful and inspect it before handling it!
